org.treetank.api

Interface IDatabase

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Database

    public interface IDatabase
    This interface describes database instances handled by treetank. A database is a persistent place where all data is stored. The access to the data is done with the help of ISessions. Furthermore, databases can be created with the help of org.access.conf.DatabaseConfigurations. After creation, the settings of a database cannot be changed.

    Usage Example

     // Simple session with standards as defined in EDatabaseSetting and 
 ESessionSetting. Creation takes place in open-process
 final IDatabase database = Database.openDatabase("examplek");
 final ISession session = database.getSession()
 
 // Database with berkeley db and incremental revisioning.
 final Properties dbProps = new Properties();
 dbProps.setProperty(STORAGE_TYPE.name(),StorageType.Berkeley.name());
 dbProps.setProperty(REVISION_TYPE.name(), ERevisioning.INCREMENTAL.name());
 final DatabaseConfiguration dbConfig = new DatabaseConfiguration("example", dbProps);
 Database.create(dbConfig);
 final IDatabase database = Database.openDatabase("examplek");
 final ISession session = database.getSession();

    Author:
    Sebastian Graf, University of Konstanz

    • Method Detail

      • createResource

        boolean createResource(ResourceConfiguration pResConf)
                       throws TTIOException
        Creation of a resource. Since databases can consist out of several resources, those can be created within this method. This includes the creation of a suitable folder structure as well as the serialization of the configuration of this resource.
        Parameters:
        pResConf - the config of the resource
        Returns:
        boolean with true if successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        TTIOException - if anything happens while creating the resource

      • getSession

        ISession getSession(SessionConfiguration pSessionConf)
                    throws TTException
        Getting the session associated within this database.
        Parameters:
        pSessionConf - SessionConfiguration.Builder reference
        Returns:
        the session
        Throws:
        TTException - if can't get session

      • truncateResource

        void truncateResource(String pResourceName)
        Truncating a resource. This includes the removal of all data stored within this resource.
        Parameters:
        pResourceName - storing the name of the resource

      • existsResource

        boolean existsResource(String pResourceName)
        Is the resource within this database existing?
        Parameters:
        pResourceName - ot be checked
        Returns:
        true, if existing; false otherwise

      • listResources

        String[] listResources()
        Listing all resources within this database.
        Returns:
        all resources

      • getLocation

        File getLocation()
        Getting the file location of this database.
        Returns:
        the File of this database

      • close

        void close()
           throws TTException
        Closing the database for further access.
        Throws:
        TTException - if anything happens within treetank.
